Authors: Yossy E.H., Karim S., Rachmantyo D.D.
Title: Development of Indonesian Language Speech Recognition Algorithm Model in Knowledge Database
Source title: 7th International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering, ICITACEE 2020 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Binus Online Learning, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yossy, E.H., Bina Nusantara University, Binus Online Learning, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Karim, S., Bina Nusantara University, Binus Online Learning, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rachmantyo, D.D., Bina Nusantara University, Binus Online Learning, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Research on humanoid robots in Indonesia is developing very rapidly, marked by research on humanoid robots having the ability to learn independently using Indonesian and vocabulary to receive and provide responses from humans based on Natural Language Processing. The general objective of research focuses on speech recognition systems to be able to interact with people naturally. Humanoid robots must be able to consider the question style and infer answers through automated, unreliable conversations in noisy environments. In development, there are still shortcomings that is if the answer is not in the knowledge base, the robot will look for the context that is most similar to the knowledge base, instead of giving an answer, the robot gives an answer 'not found'. Sometimes, the wrong answer will be displayed because the cosine value between the question and the wrong answer is influenced by the same context, that the truth is not the actual answer. Based on these problems, this study was conducted with the aim of producing structured data and information knowledge according to the topic of the question, producing knowledge storage designs, optimizing models based on design and knowing the performance of knowledge representation storage models. Based on these objectives, this research will design algorithms and modeling representation of Indonesian language knowledge that will be applied to humanoid robots. The expected output is an algorithm design and storage of knowledge representation on humanoid robots. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: humanoid robot; Indonesian; knowledge representation; question answer
Index Keywords: Anthropomorphic robots; Digital storage; Knowledge acquisition; Knowledge based systems; Knowledge representation; Machine design; Modeling languages; Natural language processing systems; Indonesian languages; Knowledge database; Knowledge storage; Model representation; NAtural language processing; Optimizing models; Recognition algorithm; Speech recognition systems; Speech recognition

Title: Mobile application design of embedded weighbridge system for palm oil industry
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Universal University, Faculty of Engineering, Software Engineering Department, Batam, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Jaya, M., Universal University, Faculty of Engineering, Software Engineering Department, Batam, Indonesia; Suharjito, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yossy, E.H., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Weighbridges are tools for determining plant productivity in the palm oil industry. Weighbridge is an embedded system that is connected to the computer via the RS-232 port. Used to measure the weight of products like CPO (Crude Palm Oil), Kernel and Shell. Some problems caused by weighbridges system in Palm Oil Industry such as incorrect of Fresh Fruit Bunch (FFB) suppliers are often occurring, then incorrect selection of the FFB area, not saving weighing data, incorrect entry of the FFB sorting data, and incorrect selection of the sales contract. Therefore, the aim of the development is a more optimal system for solving these five problems and increasing the accuracy of the weighbridge. The research methodology used is the system development life cycle using a prototype model because it is more flexible and active, so that users can see, feel, and experience the development process, and repair errors relatively quickly. The results of the development of this system are systems designed to be more efficient by developing systems with application concepts that are connected to local network connections, so that one stage of the process can be combined with other processes and data can be interconnected between one process and another. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Arm gate; Barcode; Mobile application; Weighbridges
Index Keywords: Information management; Life cycle; Palm oil; Sales; Development process; Local networks; Mobile application design; Plant productivity; Prototype models; Research methodologies; Sales contracts; System development life cycles; Petroleum industry

Title: Development model of warteg online applications based on web and mobile
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ivanovich, J.W., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Said, M.A., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rohim, S.A., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wicaksono, M.R., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yossy, E.H., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The development of software engineering as well as mobile and web-apps has enabled the modernization of businesses such as warung tegal (warteg). The purpose of this research is to design an online warteg application. Application development uses the method of developing system development life cycle with the waterfall model. This application was built using the Native React Framework and with the PostgreSQL Database. The expected result is the design of online warteg applications that can be accessed on websites and mobile phones that can help warteg entrepreneurs to facilitate the promotion and sale of merchandise they sell, as well as to facilitate the public to buy food without having to come to the warteg. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Mobile application; Sdlc; Warung tegal; Waterfall; Website
Index Keywords: Life cycle; Software engineering; Application development; Development model; On-line applications; PostgreSQL; System development life cycles; Waterfall model; Web apps; Information management

Authors: Debi, Takeuchi M., Aliyudin M.G., Nurhayati P.W., Yossy E.H.
Title: Development money diary application models on android
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Online Learning, Education Technology, Research Interest Group, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Debi, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Takeuchi, M., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aliyudin, M.G., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nurhayati, P.W., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yossy, E.H., BINUS Online Learning, Education Technology, Research Interest Group, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Today many people have difficulty controlling their time and finances. This certainly affects self-productivity and work productivity in the office / business. With the establishment of the Money Diary application, it is expected to become a solute task and money management application. The purpose of making this application is to assist users in managing and managing their tasks and finances all at once in an application. The research method used in data collection is literature study and indirect observation. The application development method uses the system development life cycle method with the waterfall model. This model uses a systematic and sequential approach that starts at the level of requirement to the level of maintenance. This application is based on Android developed with the Java programming language. The result is a money diary application that can be used to daily actions, to remind users of the need to pay bills on time, to facilitate financial management for users, to remind users to perform certain actions that were previously planned. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Android; Mobile application; Money diary; System development life cycle
Index Keywords: Computer programming; Finance; Information management; Life cycle; Productivity; Application development; Application models; Financial managements; Literature studies; research methods; Sequential approach; System development life cycles; Work productivity; Android (operating system)

Authors: Yossy E.H., Suparta W., Trisetyarso A., Abbas B.S., Kang C.H.
Title: Measurement of usability for speech recognition on Ok Google
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Binus Graduate Program—Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, West Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yossy, E.H., Computer Science Department, Binus Graduate Program—Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, West Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suparta, W., Computer Science Department, Binus Graduate Program—Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, West Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisetyarso, A., Computer Science Department, Binus Graduate Program—Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, West Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abbas, B.S., Computer Science Department, Binus Graduate Program—Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, West Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kang, C.H., Computer Science Department, Binus Graduate Program—Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, West Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As technology develops, Google can accept input not only by typing keywords but also through speech. Speech as input to Google is known as the Ok Google feature. However, many search engine users never pay attention to search engine definitions. So, websites are only limited to projects without further management, and that is what happens to the current website. Therefore, in this study, an assessment of usability is conducted on Google especially in the Ok Google feature using Nielsen Model. The research method used in this research is the quantitative research approach, a method which includes approach and kind of research, population and sample, instrument, data collection technique, and data analyze. Data collection techniques include learnability, efficiency, memorability, errors and satisfaction assessment and Likert scale ranges from 1 to 4. It can be signed into categories of sites with usability values, namely “very difficult to understand,” “difficult to understand”, “easy to understand” and “very easy to understand”. The construct validity is with Orthogonal Iterations with Index reliability of 0.91. The results of this study are the usability testing of Ok Google tends to be significance (α) of 5% with data of 124 is 1.66, feedback statement in the questionnaire is considered valid, then the questionnaire results show α = 0.91 which means the measurement of usability on Ok Google Feature is an excellent level. The average usability value obtained by Ok Google in Indonesia is included in the category of usability “easy to understand”. In addition, it was found that Ok Google has the highest memorability level and the lowest error. © Springer Nature Switzerland AG 2020.

Title: Comparison of Data Mining Classification Algorithms for Student Performance
Source title: TALE 2019 - 2019 IEEE International Conference on Engineering, Technology and Education
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department1480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yossy, E.H., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department1480, Indonesia; Heryadi, Y., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department1480, Indonesia; Lukas, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department1480, Indonesia
Abstract: Student performance has an important role to measure student quality. Student quality can be measured through predictions of student performance. Prediction can be done using data mining techniques. One technique that can be used is the classification method. The research aims to find out which classification model has the best performance related to student performance data. The data used is taken from UCI Machine Learning, namely student performance. The study used seven methods, namely K-nearest neighbor, classification and regression trees, naïve bayes, adaboost, extratree, bernaoulli naïve bayes, random forest. The technology used to compare the seven methods uses Python programming. Testing the performance of methods using cross validation. The results of this study are the comparison of student performance classification algorithms on student math, namely K-Nearest Neighboring of 86.52%, classification and regression tests of 86.08%, naïve bayes of 84.78%, adaboost of 88.04%, extratree of 81.30%, bernaoulli naïve bayes of 79.34%, random forest E of 87.82%, random forest G of 89.78%. Based on these results we know that the best classification method is the random forest G of 89.78%. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: algorithms; classification; data mining; student performance
Index Keywords: Adaptive boosting; Decision trees; Education computing; Engineering education; Nearest neighbor search; Random forests; Students; Classification algorithm; Classification and regression tree; Classification methods; Classification models; Data mining classification algorithms; K-nearest neighbors; Python programming; Student performance; Data mining

Authors: Rabiha S.G., Yossy E.H., Indrianti Y., Samoko
Title: A Neural network based approach for predicting Indonesian teacher engagement index (itei)
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference of Artificial Intelligence and Information Technology, ICAIIT 2019
Affiliations: Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rabiha, S.G., Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yossy, E.H., School of Computer Science, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Samoko, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The Indonesian Teacher Engagement Index (ITEI) is an instrument designed to help teachers detect themselves through self-diagnostics. In this study we use the Neural Network approach to predict Index values and assess parameters in the Neural Network. The analysis of this study is based on several variables including the input layer of the proposed ANN model as many as 28 parameters obtained from the ITEI application related to the teacher index value. After training our network we obtain a Root Mean Square Error of around 0.2%. The best model that can be suggested by the Neural Network to sample the Indonesian Teacher Engagement Index (ITEI) is in the condition when the Learning rate value: 0.3, momentum: 0.5, Number of Hidden Layer: 2 where the number of Neurons in layer 1 is 6 and Neuron in layer 2 is equal to 6. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Mean square error; Neural networks; ANN modeling; Hidden layers; Learning rates; Network-based approach; Root mean square errors; Self-diagnostics; Several variables; Teacher Engagement; Multilayer neural networks

Authors: Rabiha S.G., Murmanto I.R., Sasmoko, Yossy E.H., Kusumastuti D.L.
Title: Consumer segmentation using case based reasoning approach to printing company
Source title: 2018 International Seminar on Research of Information Technology and Intelligent Systems, ISRITI 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia

Abstract: Every print produced by the printing machine in printshop was recorded in the machine log. This machine log contains a variety of information about the printed product produced. By analyzing the login, it is expected to find patterns that can be used to find out customer needs. Case-based Reasoning is a knowledge transformation technique used in the context of a new algorithm. The way to find out the case-based reason is to use data mining techniques. One technique is the C4.5 method, called the tree data mining method which is often used in classifying and making rules based on transactional data or facts. The purpose of this study is to determine the rules or segmentation of customers. So that in the future the rules generated from this context can be used in system development. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yossy E.H., Kusumastuti D.L., William A., Mukhneri, Sasmoko, Indrianti Y.
Title: Student satisfaction on e-learning website sasmoko.com
Source title: 2018 International Seminar on Research of Information Technology and Intelligent Systems, ISRITI 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information System STMIK Kuwera, Jakarta, 12310, Indonesia; Educational Management, Universitas Negeri Jakarta, Jakarta, 13220, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Humanities, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yossy, E.H., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kusumastuti, D.L., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; William, A., Information System STMIK Kuwera, Jakarta, 12310, Indonesia; Mukhneri, Educational Management, Universitas Negeri Jakarta, Jakarta, 13220, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Primary Teacher Education Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Humanities, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Primary Teacher Education Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Humanities, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: E-learning implementation has become an inseparable part of the learning process. One platform has been developed for student learning through sasmoko.com. The e-learning needs to be evaluated specifically related to student satisfaction. Survey research method with the Neuroresearch approach, which is a Mixed Method which includes exploratory, explanatory and confirmatory research stages. Data collection techniques with satisfaction assessment sheets, Likert scale ranges from 1 to 5. Construct validity with Orthogonal Iterations, Index reliability of 0.865. The results of the study: (1) students' assessment of sasmoko.com e-learning tends to be significantly satisfied at α <0.05, (2) students are more satisfied learning using blended learning (e-learning as a face to face/classical complement) compared learning that uses full e-learning and also only face to face in class without e-learning, significantly at α <0.05, (3) students from Humanities major significantly more satisfied using sasmoko.com e-learning than students from majors Information Technology is significantly at α <0.05, (4) there is no difference in student satisfaction if distinguished by semester, age and average length of internet access, (5) students who study through sasmoko.com e-learning and have internet access at home (in addition to access on campus) proved to be more satisfied with learning than those with internet facilities only on campus, and (6) more satisfied male students learning through sasmoko.com elearning female students were significantly at α < 0.05 © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Blended Learning; E-Learning; Neuroresearch; User Satisfaction; Website
Index Keywords: E-learning; Intelligent systems; Websites; Blended learning; Construct validity; Learning process; Neuroresearch; Orthogonal iteration; Student satisfaction; Students learning; User satisfaction; Students

Authors: Yossy E.H., Sasmoko, Kusumastuti D.L., Rabiha S.G., Indrianti Y.
Title: Model artificial intelligent in E-learning using fuzzy logic (Case Study Sasmoko.Com)
Source title: International Journal of Engineering and Technology(UAE)
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Information System Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Faculty of Social, Podomoro University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yossy, E.H., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kusumastuti, D.L., Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Rabiha, S.G., Information System Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Faculty of Social, Podomoro University, Jakarta, Indonesia, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The advancement of information technology has been maximally utilized in the world of education, especially in the learning process. One form is e-learning. In its development, e-learning has several problems when faced with the background and needs of students who take part in learning. These differences affect the effectiveness of learning because not all students have the same learning style. To over-come these problems, researchers tried to use fuzzy logic methods. Fuzzy logic is chosen to answer the uncertainty that occurs in learning subjective student characters. Therefore, the study was conducted on one e-learning website called sasmoko.com. The e-learning website is a research method course where students from various backgrounds and needs are used. In this study a model was proposed in as-sessing student characters on the sasmoko.com website. © 2018 Authors.
Funding Text 1: The research was funded by Bina Nusantara University with a Binus Grant fund for the period of 2018. The object of the re-search was the sasmoko.com website with the address https://sasmoko.com which was built by Prof. Sasmoko, one of the Professors at Bina Nusantara University.

Authors: Kusumastuti D.L., Sasmoko, Yossy E.H., Rabiha S.G., Indrianti Y.
Title: Usability Efficiency Analysis on E-Learning Websites
Source title: International Journal of Engineering and Technology(UAE)
Affiliations: Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Information System Department, Binus Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Faculty of Social, Podomoro University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia

Abstract: The challenge of website-based information technology is how to channel information globally quickly and precisely. The goal is that the website is not still visited by visitors, especially for e-learning website. But many challenges for e-learning service administrators. E-learning website should provide good usability, so that interaction with learners can be done quickly and precisely. The purpose of this study is to analyze the efficiency level of usability on e-learning website in case of sasmoko.com by using Nielsen model. Data analysis was carried out using the descriptive analysis technique and the next percentage was assessed for the efficiency criteria. The results of the analysis proved to improve usability on sasmoko.com site, so it can support lectures of Research Methods as blended learning. © 2018 Authors.

Authors: Yossy E.H., Pranata J., Wijaya T., Hermawan H., Budiharto W.
Title: Mango Fruit Sortation System using Neural Network and Computer Vision
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Sciences, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yossy, E.H., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Sciences, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pranata, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Sciences, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, T., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Sciences, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hermawan, H., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Sciences, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiharto, W., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Sciences, Bina Nusantara University, Syahdan Campus, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Mango has different colors and sizes that indicate the level of maturity. Mango maturity level often makes farmers confused when choosing a mango that has a good maturity. Sometimes, mango farmers still use manual methods to distinguish mango maturity, while the way that human labor is often inaccurate and different in its determination. The difference is due to the different perceptions of each person. From these problems then the need of machine sorting system on agriculture is felt important. Therefore, researchers will conduct research on mango sortation system. Mango has many types such as "Harum Manis", "Apple", "Gincu", etc. In this study type of mango that will be studied is mango "Gincu" because has a good color distribution. The goal of the research is to create a system that can sort mango that ripe or unripe. The method that used to do this research is separated into few step: problem identification, algorithm development, implementation and evaluation. The system is made using C language, Computer Vision and ANN (Artificial Neural Network) so the system can detect the color of mango that has been ripe or unripe. The output of this research will be compared to related research. The final output of this research is the system can detect the ripe or unripe mango with 94% accuracy. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.

Authors: Ivan C., Rumondor P.C.B., Ricky M.Y., Yossy E.H., Budiharto W.
Title: Help the Math Town: Adaptive Multiplayer Math-Science Games using Fuzzy Logic
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Psychology Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ivan, C., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Rumondor, P.C.B., Psychology Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Ricky, M.Y., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Yossy, E.H., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Budiharto, W., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The mobile games for education and entertainment are rapidly developed. Unfortunately the development of interesting and entertaining adaptive multiplayer game based learning for math and science that consider psychological aspects and game balancing for students on mobile platforms that have game balancing is very limited. This paper proposes an integrated model of adaptive Math and Science game based learning for elementary school students with adjustable level of difficulty based on user's ability and additional option for "Free" and "Adventures" modes. We propose a method where level of difficulty can be adjusted based on previous score, using fuzzy two inputs in the form of percentage correct and the speed of answer to produce output. The experimental results are presented and show the adaptive games are running well on mobile devices based on Android platform and well received by elementary school students grade 3 to 6. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: adaptive games; android; fuzzy; psychological aspects
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Artificial intelligence; Computation theory; Education computing; Fuzzy logic; Students; Adaptive games; android; Elementary schools; fuzzy; Game-based Learning; Integrated modeling; Level of difficulties; Psychological Aspects; Education
